Docs.summary: Returns this hunk as a string in a diff-style format.
Docs.returns: A string representation of this hunk, showing the corresponding lines in the first list followed by the corresponding lines in the second list.

Docs.summary: Whether this hunk represents ranges in the lists considered equal.
Docs.value: True if the two lists did not differ in this hunk, otherwise false.

Docs.summary: The range of the first list that this hunk represents.
Docs.value: The range of the first list that this hunk represents.

Docs.summary: The range of the second list that this hunk represents.
Docs.value: The range of the second list that this hunk represents.

Docs.summary: A hunk is a segment of a diff. It relates a region of the base document to a region of the changed document.

remarks.para: Hunks are not only used for parts of a diff in which there are changes. Hunks are created such that every line in each list is represented by some hunk.
